transcript.text: Hello everyone, welcome to NISO Academy. Let's start with the first one that is introduction to static data members. So what are static data members? A static data member is a member of the class that can be declared using the keyword static inside the class. So within the class, we can only declare a static data member and we can declare the static data member with the help of the static keyword. If we want to define the static data member, then we can only define it outside the class. This is what I have written as the second point. It must be defined outside the class. Also, it is shared by all the objects of the class. It is not the case that each object will receive its own copy of the static data member. Every object has to share the same copy of the static data member. So it is shared by all the objects of the class. Also, if we want to access a static data member, then it is possible through the class name, not the object name. So it can be accessed using the class name because it is created on a class basis, not on an object basis. It is not associated with an object. It is associated with the class. I hope these points are clear to you. Now let's see how to declare a static data member inside the class. Let's see the syntax for the same.
